page.title: 04EVENTS:Local Exhibitions
page.content: During the period of time in which the survey took place, there were two exhibitions in Brampton. The first one was concerned with the renovation and preservation of old buildings plus the addition of some new buildings specially designed to blend with the old ones. Plans were shown of what was to take place with photographs and artists impressions of what the area would look like on completion. The renovation of the old buildings is due to a private organisation known as the Brampton Preservation Trust which was formed in 1981. The second exhibition was called 'Brampton in the Past' and consisted of a display of old photographs, school records, business accounts, and local events which took place mainly in the 19th century.
